title: Program Catalog Radiologic Technology

school.name: School of Nursing, Allied Health, and Biological Sciences

program_name: Bachelor of Science in Radiologic Technology (BSRT)

vision_mission.slu_vision: Saint Louis University is envisioned as an excellent missionary and transformative educational institution zealous in developing human resources imbued with Christian spirit and who are creative, competent, and socially involved.
vision_mission.school_vision: The School of Nursing, Allied Health and Biological Sciences envisions herself as the seat of excellence in Nursing, Allied Health and Biological Sciences Education that is dynamic and inspired by a Christian way of living, producing globally competitive and value-laden nurses and healthcare professionals in the service of humanity.

educational_objectives: Demonstrate empathy, sympathy, and compassion in patient care and safe handling of imaging equipment.
Perform creative and effective radiographic procedures across varying conditions and resources.
Exhibit expertise in medical imaging systems through continued quality education.
Engage in community projects and research in Radiologic Technology.
learning_outcomes: Apply interdisciplinary knowledge (sciences, humanities) in radiologic practice.
Compare imaging and therapy modalities for proper application.
Demonstrate technical radiologic skills for accurate diagnosis and compassionate care.
Communicate effectively in both English and Filipino.
Implement radiation safety, MRI protocols, and informed consent procedures.
Maximize imaging machine life and departmental operations.
Participate in research and lifelong learning.
Practice the profession within legal, ethical, and moral standards.
Adapt technical skills to varied clinical scenarios.
Combine critical thinking and Christian values in leadership or entrepreneurial settings.
Advocate patriotism and service to the Filipino people.
Live and serve according to CICM Christian values.

undergraduate_freshmen: Must pass the SLU College Entrance Examination (SLU-CEE).
Admission starts mid-April; exams are conducted October to December.
transfer_students: Must pass: Qualifying Exam (QE), Personality Test, Interview
RadTech major/professional subjects from previous institutions will not be credited.

graduate_program_students.masters: Must have a Baccalaureate degree in a relevant field.
graduate_program_students.doctorate: Must have a Master’s degree in a related field.

foreign_students: Apply at least 6 months before the term begins.
Arrive in Baguio 4 weeks before classes start for: English Proficiency Test (EPT), SLU-CEE / QE / GPEE, Personality Test
Must undergo pre-admission processing and hold a valid Student Visa.

tuition_and_fees.note: Subject to change without prior notice
